Key Arguments: The bill infringes on freedom of speech, which is essential for a democratic society.
Censorship by the government is more damaging than misinformation and disinformation.
There are conflicts of interest in institutions influenced by financial incentives from large companies, particularly in the pharmaceutical industry.
The bill could lead to unethical practices in the medical field, as seen during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The bill would create costly bureaucracy and represents government overreach.
Compliance costs would burden small businesses, particularly those offering alternatives to mainstream medicine.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of Speech is a hallmark of a democratic society. Any curtailment of this freedom will inevitably lead to tyranny.
Censorship is far more damaging than misinformation and disinformation.
This is the domain of tyrants and the method all totalitarian governments work from. This is un-Australian.
The bill is another example of government over reach: the increasing interference in peopleâ€™s lives from government.
